name: Terracotta Army
quote: 'Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.' - Sun Tzu

name: Uffizi
quote: 'The painter is not simply someone who looks and who sees. Above all, the artist is someone who exposes a personal vision by rendering it visible.'  - Marcel Parquet

name: Parthenon
quote: 'Earth proudly wears the Parthenon as the best gem upon her zone.' - Ralph Waldo Emerson

name: Burj Khalifa
quote: 'The tallest building in the world, with a total height of 829.8 m (2,722 ft, or just over half a mile).'

name: Abu Simbel

civilopediaText.text: Abu Simbel is a set of two rock temples located in southern Egypt, just off the coast of Lake Nasser. Commisioned by Ramesess II, it commemerates his victory in the Battle of Kadesh.

quote: 'The heads of Rameses II at Abu Simbel and, for that matter, the skyscrapers of New York, have another idea of man.' - John Leonard

name: Baffin Island Inukshuks

civilopediaText.text: Inukshuks, also known as Inuksuks, are large humanoid megaliths, built by the First Nations of Canada. They serve a variety of uses, ostly related to navigation, since their large stature can easily mark a hunting ground or food cache from a distance. The place with the most Inukshuks is on Baffin Island, where over 100 are located on just a small peninsula alone. Inukshuks serve as a national icon of the Canadian people, being present on the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympic Icon.

uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production, +1 Culture] from [Tundra] tiles [in this city]
[+1 Science, +1 Production, +1 Happiness] from [Snow] tiles [in this city]
quote: 'If you are going to walk on thin ice, you might as well dance.' - Inuit Proverb

name: Gobekli Tepe

civilopediaText.text: It is very rare that a single archeaological site can completely change how we view prehistory, but Gobleki Tepe did just that. Located in modern-day Turkiye, this site is the oldest known human settlement, predating the invention of agriculture. It is covered in stone carvings and designs of a culture that have developed settlements before the stories of Gilgamesh or of Amun-Ra. Not only does this site hold major importance in how we veiw humanities origins, but it is also a holy site for many Turkish Sufi's. Many Sufi's still visit the site to pray even after excavations, however they now need to avoid hordes of tourists flocking to the site.

quote: 'Is Gobekli Tepe evidence of a lost advanced civilisation from the ice age, or is it shocking proof that ancient people knew how to put rocks on top of each other?' - Milo Rossi

name: Great Sphinx

civilopediaText.text: The Sphinx is a large structure located beside the Great Pyramids, facing east so that it is always facing the sunrise.. The sphinx is a mythical creature that is shared among many different cultures across the world, similar to that of dragons. Current theories suggest that the Sphinx was built so that the tombs and templesbehind it were defended from evil.

uniques: [+2 Faith, +2 Culture] from every [Wonder] <in this city>
quote: 'There are various eyes. Even the Sphinx has eyes: and as a result there are various truths, and as a result there is no truth' - Friedrich Nietzsche

name: Gunung Padang
uniques: [+1] population [in this city] <upon entering a Golden Age>
quote: On the mountain top Goenoeng Padang, near Goenoeng Melati, a succession of 4 terraces, connected by steps of rough stone, paved with rough flat stones and decorated with numerous sharp and columnar upright andesite stones. On each terrace a small mound, probably a grave, surrounded and covered with stones and topped with 2 pointed stones.' - Rogier Verbeek

name: Karnak

civilopediaText.text: Karnak is a temple comlex located in Luxor, Egypt. Here lies the work of 30 generations of pharaohs, each one adding to the temples over the cource of heir reign. Gods from the stories of the ancient pantheons of Egypt, to the ashes of Aten, to the sermons of Coptic Church are all present here. Currently it is the second most visited landmark in Egypt, with only the Great Pyramids overtaking it.

uniques: [+3 Faith] from [Flood plains] tiles [in this city]
Must have an owned [Flood plains] within [2] tiles
quote: 'Man, know yourself… and you shalt know the gods.' - Inscription at Karnak

name: Mesa Verde

civilopediaText.text: A large mesa located in Colorado,USA, Mesa Verde is the location of possibly one of the first pueblo settlments in the Mojave Desert. The people who settled here would late grow into thr Pueblo people, who carved a trade network accross the entire South west of thr modern-day United States. The cliff-dwelling people dispersed in the 1200's, resulting in the site being deeply ingraned in the folklore of the surrounding cultures, coloniser and natives alike.

quote: 'The government never gave anybody anything. You make these homesteads go, you'll have earned every acre of it. You just can't make 'em go on the Mesa Verde!' - McLintock!

name: Nazca Geoglyphs

civilopediaText.text: Carved in the rock of the Nazca Desert, these markings have lead to great speculation worldwide. Some of the smaller lines are most likely just water collecting ducts, but the purpose of the larger geoglyphs is what makes the site so interesting. Patterns and depictions of many different animals cover the land, so large that planes and satelites are needed to fully observe them. We still do not know the purpose of these geoglyphs, and we are constantly discovering new structures in the area, meaning this site is constantly experiencing new breakthroughs.

uniques: Must have an owned [Mountain] within [2] tiles
quote: 'If the Nazca Lines were made by humans for the gods, these figures were made by humans for humans.' - Luis Jaime Castillo

name: Temple of Obelisks

civilopediaText.text: The Temple of Obelisks are a large temple comlex in the ruins of the old Phonecian city of Byblos. Here, as the name suggests, are a large number of obelisks, all from different pantheors of gods, event including some ancient egypthian gods too. The site is now a locaton of national pride, as it is the tourim poster-child for Lebanon, with this wonder aloe generating significant amounts of the tourism income for the country.

quote:
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay 
Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare 
The lone and level sands stretch far away.' - Ozymandias, Percy Bysshe Shelley

name: Wurdi Youang

civilopediaText.text: located in Victoria,Australia, this megalithic site was built by native Australian Aboriginals. Its purpose is most likely similar to other megalithic sites such as Stonehenge, as it is alignes to the Solstices and the Equinoxes. Currently we do not know its exact age, but current estimates say that it could be around 11,000 years old, making it 6,000 years older than the oldest parts of Stonehenge.

uniques: [+1 Science] from [Plantation] tiles [in all cities] <before founding a religion>
quote: The more you know, the less you need.' - Aboriginal Saying
